patient_information: Age: 36 years Sex: male Travel history: recent travel to Botswana, Okavango Delta Comorbidities: none reported
chief_complaint: mobile itchy mass under skin for past 3 weeks
history_of_present_illness: Onset: three weeks ago Symptoms: ["itchy, serpiginous rash tracking from groin to chest", "mass reappearing on right shoulder"] Duration: past 3 weeks Severity pattern: migratory and intermittent
exposure_and_epidemiology: Travel details: ["fishing trip to Okavango Delta in Botswana", "consumed raw fish from the river"] Vector exposures: none reported Animal exposures: none reported Water food risks: none reported Contacts: two travel companions with similar symptoms Season outbreak context: recent return from Botswana Occupation: restaurant owner
physical_exam: Skin exam: mobile itchy mass Heent exam: normal Chest exam: normal Abdominal exam: normal Neurological exam: normal Lymph nodes: no lymphadenopathy
labs_and_diagnostics: {'CBC': 'total white cell count 8.9 × 10^9/L (reference range: 4–10), eosinophil count 0.9 × 10^9/L (<0.5)', 'liver_function_tests': None, 'creatinine_and_electrolytes': None, 'HIV_antibodies': 'negative', 'serology_for_Gnathostoma': 'negative'}
differential_diagnosis: {'diagnosis': 'Gnathostomiasis', 'evidence': ['mobile itchy mass', 'eosinophilia', 'travel history to Okavango Delta', 'consumption of raw fish']}; {'diagnosis': 'Sparganosis', 'evidence': ['migratory swellings and eosinophilia', 'history of eating raw or undercooked food items']}
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: ["albendazole 400 mg bid for 21 days", "ivermectin 200 μg/kg on two consecutive days"] Response to treatment: mass migrated over shoulder and neck, disappeared for 24 hours, then reappeared between eyebrows, moved to forehead and face Outcome: full resolution of symptoms after treatment
final_diagnosis: Disease name short: Gnathostomiasis Confirmation method: clinical presentation with eosinophilia, migratory swellings, travel history, and consumption of raw fish Evidence: ["mobile itchy mass", "eosinophilia", "travel to Okavango Delta", "consumption of raw fish"]
